column5: Pretty happy with the way it turned out.2x6's and hardwood crossers.4" stainless screws and stainless bolts where needed.Epoxy on the ski joint as insurance,PL400 deck and subfloor caulk where the crossers screw onto the legs.Saturday will be the big test,or first test.Hope I don't throw a ski lol.All the materials were what I owned already and the skis were free for the taking.
Nice job Davey.  Now paint the rest of the skis black,add some white scull decals . LOL

Nice job Davey.  Now paint the rest of the skis black,add some white scull decals . LOL Ran out of paint Brian,have more at home.Will paint the skis and thinking some yellow flames on all 4 2X6's lol.Sculls would be a nice touch!!!!!
Looks great! I'm gonna have to build one of these...

Looks great! I'm gonna have to build one of these...   Pete  I had to use that sleigh I bought off you last year for 5 buck. Sure pulls with ease, and I had it loaded with all my gear. That sleigh will never be let go.  Cant wait to get started on my new smitty model.
Looks good Davey, in the summer you can fill it with ice and some pop's in it . Ice on , ice in . All season smitty
The first test maybe the ultimate,going down line 2 as a lot of you know what I'm talking about Saturday.Thanks for the feed back.
Looks good Davey, in the summer you can fill it with ice and some pop's in it . Ice on , ice in . All season smitty
The first test maybe the ultimate,going down line 2 as a lot of you know what I'm talking about Saturday.Thanks for the feed back.  Put a rope on the back. Simple.

Put a rope on the back. Simple. Saw a couple guys last Sat,bumper skiing off the back on the way down lmao.My tub on it's own would maybe slide a couple feet at a time .Should be a nice change I'm hoping ?.Rope on the back,geez,back at it again lol.Thanks Brian.

If you have a spare anchor screw, tie your smitty to it if it windy.  When I was setting up yesterday morning, my little lilly (bless her little heart) was yelling oh no  poppy poppy. LOOK. My sleigh was blowing away.LOL I think we did this last year as well.LOL

If you have a spare anchor screw, tie your smitty to it if it windy.  When I was setting up yesterday morning, my little lilly (bless her little heart) was yelling oh no  poppy poppy. LOOK. My sleigh was blowing away.LOL I think we did this last year as well.LOL I do for my two hubs when extremely windy ,thanks,great idea.,Thinking maybe adding a lag eyebolt on the outside of each 2X6 to use bungie cords to help hold the auger and other things in.Have had a couple fall offs this winter but someone always following behind.Good thing.What a cutie she is Brian!!!!
Thanks  She,s my fisher girl.
nice job Dave - you may need a pfd on Saturday if this weather keeps up
Nice, a 6" lift! Time for dual exhaust and a spoiler!

You guys have too much time on your hands!  Skulls, flames, dual exhaust!  Too funny!  A spoiler?  I don't even know him - but he doesn't walk that fast!  I do like the idea of a beer cooler in the summer.  All season usage!  Amazing!
Awesome looking ride!

Thanks guys again for the replies,easy to build,basic as you can get.Hope it stands up.May have to tweak,but that's ok.The dual exhaust ,fender flares and flames may have to wait a bit ,the 6" lift kit was money well spent lol. Update after Saturdays trial run.
Nice job. What are you pulling it with?
Nice job. What are you pulling it with? Thanks.Still a walker Don.

Here's what I was able to throw together, I was inspired to finally get it together after meeting brian on lake joe with his sweet rig lol. It made the slush from the thaw today a breeze to pull through on simcoe, with no bogging at all. I still have a few mods that I want to do to fit my needs, also a paint job is in order, but I'm glad I finally finished it instead of having an old set of ski's rusting in my backyard
Nicely done!!!
